intro: Aster trinervius var. firmus, commonly known as the firm aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with yellow centers, and it produces seeds in small, fluffy clusters. This species is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
